pageContext.description: Dimensions: Length: 20" or 54.5 cm; Width: 1 1/2" or 3.8 cms,Bent. Broken near point where finder tried to straighten. Pommel end of hilt broken off. Small cast holes below rivet holes.
pageContext.collection: On loan to Peterborough Museum,From finder Mr. Tony Hancock, Frengate, Peterborough
pageContext.site: England,Cambridgeshire,(Isle of Ely),Worth Stanground,Horsey Toll Farm,Jan. 1964
pageContext.toSearch: Stanground, Peterborough, Peterborough, Peterborough Pe2, UK
pageContext.remarks: *Measured along bend, appears shorter in drawing.,Dug up by rotary cultivator working at depth of 4" to 6".
